OCaml Labs

These are software packages developed and maintained at OCaml Labs, either directly by us or with our industrial collaborators at Citrix, Jane Street, OCamlPro, and of course with a huge amount of help from the wider OCaml community.

stog

  • 0.4
  • 0.5
  • 0.6.1
  • 0.7.0
  • version 0.8.0
Maintainer zoggy@bat8.org
Dependencies ocamlfind & xmlm >= 1.1 & xtmpl >= 0.5 & config-file >= 1.1 & ocamlnet >= 3.6 & ocamlrss >= 2.1.0
Last update Jun 3, 2013
Source http://zoggy.github.com/stog/stog-0.8.0.tar.gz
587af11965dfe000e65a54c6a93adfb7
Statistics Not installed in the last month.

A static web site generator, able to handle blog posts as well as regular pages.

In one sentence, Stog is a kind of Jekyll in OCaml: It is a static web site generator, able to handle blog posts as well as regular pages.

The main differences are:

  • It is developped in OCaml and can be extended with OCaml plugins. - It is based on a xml engine allowing to apply substitutions on some tags. Some substitutions are pre-defined, and others can be added by plugins. - It easily supports multi-language sites.

Dependencies
ocamlrss ( >= 2.1.0 )
ocamlnet ( >= 3.6 )
config-file ( >= 1.1 )
xtmpl ( >= 0.5 )
xmlm ( >= 1.1 )
ocamlfind
Required by
stog-rdf
stog-writing
